channel.title: Changing A Client, To Fit YOUR Server
channel.description:
This may help ALOT of people. Instead of having to go through and seach every file to edit.. [b]DISCLAIMER:[/b] All this does is change the name. You still MUST give credits to creator. Unless You Have Permission, And Or Have Edited More Than 51%.
This Will Tell You What Files To Change To Edit Your Client, Making It Yours. (Well it saying your name)
[u][b]First:[/b][/u] (Make sure it is extracted) Open The Client Folder [u][b]Second:[/b][/u] Go Into The .Java Files Listed Below & Change The Name Of Their Client To Yours (EXAMPLE: For Allstar Client, I'd Go To The Following .Java Files And SEARCH "all" For Allstar, And Change The Following Server/Title To My Server Name.)
[glow=red,2,300][u][b]The .JAVA Files To EDIT:[/b][/u][/glow] Class5.Java Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.Java Frame_Sub1.Java Server.Java Client.Java Signlink.Java

item.title: Changing A Client, To Fit YOUR Server
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

This is the most stupid thing I have ever seen.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing A Client, To Fit YOUR Server
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Demons Pure Demons
item.description:
@Pure_Demons wrote:

[quote=“theyungbubba, post:1, topic:326263”]This may help ALOT of people. Instead of having to go through and seach every file to edit…
DISCLAIMER: All this does is change the name. You still MUST give credits to creator. Unless You Have Permission, And Or Have Edited More Than 51%.

This Will Tell You What Files To Change To Edit Your Client, Making It Yours. (Well it saying your name)

First: (Make sure it is extracted)
Open The Client Folder
Second:
Go Into The .Java Files Listed Below & Change The Name Of Their Client To Yours
(EXAMPLE: For Allstar Client, I’d Go To The Following .Java Files And SEARCH “all” For Allstar, And Change The Following Server/Title To My Server Name.)

[glow=red,2,300]The .JAVA Files To EDIT:[/glow]
Class5.Java
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.Java
Frame_Sub1.Java
Server.Java
Client.Java
Signlink.Java[/quote]

Nerd…<.< HAI YungB, nice tutorial…

Read full topic
item.source: Changing A Client, To Fit YOUR Server

item.title: Changing A Client, To Fit YOUR Server
item.dc:creator: @theyungbubba theyungbubba
item.description:
@theyungbubba wrote:

This may help ALOT of people. Instead of having to go through and seach every file to edit…
DISCLAIMER: All this does is change the name. You still MUST give credits to creator. Unless You Have Permission, And Or Have Edited More Than 51%.

This Will Tell You What Files To Change To Edit Your Client, Making It Yours. (Well it saying your name)

First: (Make sure it is extracted)
Open The Client Folder
Second:
Go Into The .Java Files Listed Below & Change The Name Of Their Client To Yours
(EXAMPLE: For Allstar Client, I’d Go To The Following .Java Files And SEARCH “all” For Allstar, And Change The Following Server/Title To My Server Name.)

[glow=red,2,300]The .JAVA Files To EDIT:[/glow]
Class5.Java
Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub1.Java
Frame_Sub1.Java
Server.Java
Client.Java
Signlink.Java
